DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Anti-PD1 Monoclonal Antibody Anti-PD-L1 Monoclonal Antibody Cure Intent Administration Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not anti-PD-1 (monoclonal antibody directed against programmed cell death protein 1) therapy or anti-PD-L1 (a monoclonal antibody directed against programmed death-ligand 1) therapy was previously administered with the intent to cure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Anti-PD1 Monoclonal Antibody Anti-PD-L1 Monoclonal Antibody Cure Intent Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1; PD1; CD279)._A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1; CD274)._Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Anti-PD1 Monoclonal Antibody Anti-PD-L1 Monoclonal Antibody Cure Intent Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1; PD1; CD279).:A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1; CD274).:Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.:An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1; PD1; CD279).
A monoclonal antibody directed against programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1; CD274).
Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 therapy administered with curative intent.
